capsules_submitted.utterance:
You know, I've always been fascinated by Harry's story. He's like a symbol of hope for many people, especially in the wizarding world. The fact that he was destined to be "the boy who lived" is just incredible. It's amazing how his life was forever changed after that fateful day when Lord Voldemort tried to kill him as a baby.

I think what I find most interesting about Harry's story is how it shows that even in the darkest of times, there's always a way forward. He faced so many challenges and obstacles throughout his journey, but he never gave up. And in the end, he emerged victorious, not just over Voldemort, but also over his own personal struggles.

I'd say I'm fairly certain about this, it's a well-documented part of history. The whole experience is quite positive, it's inspiring to see someone who was once an orphan living with cruel relatives become one of the most beloved heroes in the wizarding world.
